the H 2 production rate is not only affected by the catalyst, but also by the photosensitizer and sacrificial agent.According to Wang's work 36, the H 2 production rate increases significantly with the increase of Co 2 , while the CO production rate reaches a plateau quickly and no longer changes.Therefore, the yield of H 2 is strongly correlated with the photosensitizer, while the yield of CO can remain relatively stable.Due to the fact that no additional photosensitizers were added during the whole cycle

help of sacrificial agents and photosensitizers to drive the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 6.Wang 36 applied a mixture of water and acetonitrile (MeCN), triethanolamine (TEOA), and Co(bpy) 3 Cl 2 for g-C 3 N 4 based CO 2 photocatalytic reduction and found that without any of the components in the system, no conversion could take place.Herein, the sacrificial agents and photosensitizers were used in this work, and the contrasting experiments were also conducted to explain the role of the components. The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
